contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} The '''European Parliament election of 2004 in Luxembourg''' was the election of [[Members of the European Parliament|MEP]] representing [[Luxembourg (European Parliament constituency)|Luxembourg constituency]] for the 2004-2009 term of the [[European Parliament]]. It was part of the wider [[European Parliament election, 2004|2004 European election]]. It was held on June 13, 2004. The national parliamentary elections took place simultaneously. The ruling [[Christian Social People's Party]] polled strongly, while the opposition [[Luxembourg Socialist Workers' Party]] lost ground. ==Candidates== {| class="wikitable" ! List # ! colspan=2| Party ! European Party ! Existing <br> seats |- | 1 | style="background-color: {{Alternative Democratic Reform Party/meta/color}}" | | [[Alternative Democratic Reform Party]] (ADR) | [[Alliance for Europe of the Nations]] | 0 |- | 2 | style="background-color: {{Democratic Party (Luxembourg)/meta/color}}" | | [[Democratic Party (Luxembourg)|Democratic Party]] (DP) | [[European Liberal Democrat and Reform Party|Liberal Democrat and Reform Party]] | 1 |- | 3 | style="background-color: {{Luxembourg Socialist Workers' Party/meta/color}}" | | [[Luxembourg Socialist Workers' Party]] (LSAP) | [[Party of European Socialists]] | 2 |- | 4 | style="background-color: {{The Greens (Luxembourg)/meta/color}}" | | [[The Greens (Luxembourg)|The Greens]] | [[European Green Party]] | 1 |- | 5 | style="background-color: {{Christian Social People's Party/meta/color}}" | | [[Christian Social People's Party]] (CSV) | [[European People's Party]] | 2 |- | 6 | style="background-color: {{The Left (Luxembourg)/meta/color}}" | | [[The Left (Luxembourg)|The Left]] | [[Party of the European Left|European Left]] | 0 |- | 7 | width=5px style="background-color: {{Communist Party of Luxembourg/meta/color}}" | | width=275px| [[Communist Party of Luxembourg|Communist Party]] (KPL) | | width=50px| 0 |} ==Results== {{Luxembourgian European election, 2004}} :Registered voters: 229,550 :Votes cast: 208,436 (90.8% turnout) :Valid votes: 1,081,475 The Luxembourg electoral system allows each voter to cast as many votes as there are members to be elected. These figures show the number of votes cast for each party, not the number of voters who cast them. Voting at European Parliament elections is obligatory (as is the case with all other kinds of elections in the country). {{Luxembourgian elections}} {{European Union elections}} {{DEFAULTSORT:European Parliament Election, 2004 (Luxembourg)}} [[Category:European Parliament election, 2004|Luxembourg]] [[Category:European Parliament elections in Luxembourg|2004, European Parliament election]] [[Category:2004 in Luxembourg|European Parliament election]] {{Luxembourg-election-stub}} {{EU-stub}}
